problem_summary_simple: Find a water cell furthest from any land cell in a grid.
problem_summary_technical: Performs a multi-source BFS starting from all land cells to find the maximum distance to any water cell.
key_insights: This problem can be modeled as finding the longest path in a grid from any 'land' node to a 'water' node.
A multi-source BFS is efficient because it explores outwards from all land cells simultaneously.
The grid itself acts as a visited set, marking visited water cells as land (or a visited state).
